result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin R. Scofield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with J. Price directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin R. Scofield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:37 p.m. Defendant Austin R. Scofield in court with attorney Michael Ross Blum.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Blum. Statement by DE. Court orders: 60 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: NC w/ J. Price, any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Michael Ross Blum in court, appearing via telephone.   Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Blum:  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Michael Ross Blum in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Blum - offer received and still reviewing discovery.  STC adjourned - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:15 am.
from Atty Blum requesting to appear by phone - Granted by the Court
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department prior to the next court appearance due to equipment problems at the Waushara Co Jail.

Case Called @ 1:35 PM: Defendant Austin R. Scofield in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to try and retain his own counsel.  Upon discussion of earnings, Def is referred to SPD for eligiblity.  Court orders $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.   Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  NGP entered by Court.   In person STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
